intro: Senecio leucus, commonly known as the White Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its flowers are white to pale yellow, and the leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Senecio leucus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
